data.title: [Solved] What does an archaeologist study a Only history that dates
data.meta_description: On Studocu you find all the lecture notes, summaries and study guides you need to pass your exams with better grades.
data.text:
What does an archaeologist study?

a.)

Only history that dates before the Paleolithic era

b.)

Fossils and the remains of ancient animal and plant life

c.)

Artworks and their development through human history

d.)

Human history and prehistory through the excavation of sites and analysis of artifacts.

2. What is true when an image is rendered from the descriptive point of view?

a.)

It is represented as a three-dimensional form on a flat two-dimensional surface.

b.)

The upper half of the image is in a frontal pose and the lower half is in a side view.

c.)

It is shown in a full side view.

d.)

It is viewed from a fixed perspective.

3. Select the true statement about Stonehenge.

a.)

It utilizes post and lintel construction.

b.)

It represents architecture from the paleolithic era.

c.)

Its structure relies on a variety of materials, including wood and stone.

d.)

The majority of the the structure is supported by smaller stones.

4. What is controlled space designed to do?

a.)

Create a spiritual and holy atmosphere.

b.)

House a great number of people in expanding city-states.

c.)

Keep invading forces out of a city-state.

d.)

Control who entered and exited a city-state.

e.)

Impress and intimidate the viewer.

5. In the Sumerian religion, the ziggurat symbolically expressed the idea that __________.

a.)

ordinary humans could approach the gods

b.)

humans could become gods

c.)

gods did not care about humans

d.)

gods dwell above humans

e.)

all men could enter
